channel.title: Breach
channel.description:
Indie FPS, very destructible.
[url]https://store.steampowered.com/app/72300[/url]
Looks like a wall hacker's paradise. :retard:
EDIT: Watching the trailer, it has wall hacks built in bscly

item.title: Breach
item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
BUT IRON MAN JEFF BRIDGES COME ON!
(that’s what I thought of when I first saw the character design for MP3 though it would be pretty badass if they could get JB on board to do the voice)

Read full topic

item.title: Breach
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
Harry-UK:

Yeah, the Max Payne series rocks…MP3 doesn’t look very special at the moment though.

We haven’t heard at all from MP3 for quite a while, wouldn’t surprised me if they’ve scrapped the hobo-looking Max and daytime gameplay and have gone back to the classy and in-shape leather jacket Max and night-time New York setting.

Read full topic

item.title: Breach
item.dc:creator: DrGonzo
item.description:
It’s not really like BC2. It plays very much like Rainbow Six:Vegas 1 and 2 but with destructible scenery and a whole lot of Counter-Strike thrown in.

So in other words, not worth your money or time.

Oh and the graphics of Riddick is clearly subjective, because I thought it looked terrible when compared with Doom 3. The level of detail in the environment is incredible in Doom 3 compared to Riddick. Also, Riddick is the only game to out plastic face Doom 3. People look proper strange in that game. I can’t say I enjoyed either game very much, the first person hand to hand combat in Riddick was unbearable.

Read full topic

item.title: Breach
item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
Basically, the whole point of Max Payne is to be awesome. I lol’d hard the first time I sniped someone using bullet time.

Read full topic

item.title: Breach
item.dc:creator: Maxx_Skywalker
item.description:
BahamutBBob:

I played it on PS2, and found it quite enjoyable. Not the best game ever by any means, but as far as movie games go, it was pretty good.

I’d stand by that as well. An above average experience, as it’s better than most movie to game adaptations. I haven’t played Max Payne yet, so I really don’t have that to compare it to, so Max Payne will be compared to Enter the Matrix in that respect, when I do get around to playing it.

Plus, I’ve made two playthroughs, and I figure, if I enjoyed it the second time around, it can’t be that bad of a game.

Read full topic

item.title: Breach
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
The Riddick game came out roughly at the same time as Doom 3 and had better graphics than that.

Read full topic

item.title: Breach
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
Enter The Matrix has a rather unenviable position among the games I’ve played- namely, my closest friends and I refer to it as “The Unmentionable Game” due to the poor-imitation Max Payne gameplay, sub-par graphics, terrible hand to hand combat system, and truely irredeemably bad driving missions. The hacking interface was also dumb.

A great movie to game conversion would be something like “The Chronicles of Riddick- Escape from Butcher Bay.” A very well made stealth action game from Starbreeze. (I played the 360 remake + sequel “Escape from Dark Athena.” Say what you will about the expansion, but the commentary mode was cool and the graphics were incredible.)

Read full topic

item.title: Breach
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
(rot)(fodder:

Well it looks like counterstrike tried to have a destructible baby with SWAT 4.

Bad bad bad. Does no one else see the SWAT 4 in there? Meybe I am just paranoid that that awful game will get remade in one way or another.

:has nightmares about SWAT 4: :fffuuu:

haha I remember that game… the second time I realized a game sucks and stopped playing after the first few minutes, the first one was enter the matrix

Read full topic

item.title: Breach
item.dc:creator: Maxx_Skywalker
item.description:
Played the demo on the 360. Pretty much a poor man’s Battlefield.

It’s not bad by any means, but I don’t see it excelling it any particular area. Textures are a little muddy, and the maps are as generic as you can get. However, it was fun enough to play, and just maybe, it can make a discounted buy.

Read full topic

item.title: Breach
item.dc:creator: Maverix26
item.description:
Not interested.

There are plenty other games with that taste of destructability, and then some (i.e R.F:G, BFBC2, and maybe even Crysis). The fact that it’s only stand point on buying it is “Oh look, you can blow walls up and stuff” doesn’t catch my attention d:

Read full topic

item.title: Breach
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
Katana:

Unfortunately, that makes me almost certain I won’t like it.
(Wishes he still had the $50 that he spent BC2 on)

You Don’t like BC2?? :aah: I’m in love with that game. I only spent 7 dollars on it but I would have gladly paid full price if I had to.

On topic: Game looks kinda meh, I’m distrusting of fps indie games and this one doesn’t look any special.

item.title: Breach
item.dc:creator: Surplus
item.description:
Maxey:

It actually does support dedicated servers. Surplus, try checking the Steam page game of the game next time you think about throwing around unverified claims.

I read it on a unofficial forum, that the dedicated server support isn’t true dedicated server support. However I have just read that they fix/updated it.

However apparently that it still a non-issue because the lag is tremendous anyways https://www.breachforums.com/showthread.php?t=144

According to them they are working on a fix, but I’d hold off on buying it until they do.

Read full topic

item.title: Breach
item.dc:creator: Preda
item.description:
Haven’t we seen similar levels of destructibility in Crysis (shacks and houses that came down with a grenade)? I’ll admit that riverstone walls and bridges crashing is cool, but a whole game about that?
